name: PCI DSS v4.0
description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) v4.0 provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect payment account data. It applies to all entities that store, process, or transmit cardholder data.

domains.name: Requirement 1: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls

controls.title: Network Security Control Policies and Procedures
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures related to network security controls are documented, kept up to date, and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: Firewall and Router Configuration Standards
controls.description: Configuration standards for firewalls, routers, and network security controls are defined, implemented, and maintained. Standardized configurations reduce misconfigurations that expose cardholder data.

controls.title: Inbound Traffic Restriction to CDE
controls.description: Inbound traffic to the cardholder data environment is restricted to only that which is necessary. Limiting inbound access reduces the attack surface for cardholder data systems.

domains.name: Requirement 2: Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components

controls.title: Secure Configuration Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for applying secure configurations are documented and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: Vendor Default Accounts and Settings
controls.description: Vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters are changed before installing on the network. Default credentials are commonly exploited by attackers.

controls.title: Data Retention and Disposal Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for protecting stored account data are documented, in use, and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: SAD Not Retained After Authorization
controls.description: Sensitive authentication data is not retained after authorization, even if encrypted. Eliminating post-authorization SAD storage removes a high-value target for attackers.

controls.title: PAN Rendering Unreadable
controls.description: Primary account number is rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored using strong cryptography, truncation, masking, or hashing. Rendering PAN unreadable protects it even if storage is compromised.

domains.name: Requirement 4: Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission

controls.title: Transmission Encryption Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for protecting cardholder data during transmission are documented and known to all affected parties.
typical_evidence: Encryption policy for data in transit

controls.title: Strong Cryptography for Transmission
controls.description: Strong cryptography and security protocols are used to safeguard cardholder data during transmission over open, public networks. Encryption prevents interception during transit.

domains.name: Requirement 5: Protect All Systems and Networks from Malicious Software

controls.title: Anti-Malware Deployment
controls.description: An anti-malware solution is deployed on all systems commonly affected by malicious software. Comprehensive anti-malware coverage detects and prevents malware infections.

controls.title: Anti-Malware Active and Monitored
controls.description: The anti-malware solution is kept current, performs periodic scans, and generates audit logs. Active monitoring ensures malware is detected and addressed promptly.

domains.name: Requirement 6: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems and Software

controls.title: Secure Development Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for developing and maintaining secure systems and software are documented and known to affected parties.

controls.title: Security Patch Management
controls.description: Custom and third-party software components are inventoried and security patches are applied in a timely manner. Timely patching closes known vulnerabilities before they can be exploited.

controls.title: Secure Coding Practices
controls.description: Software development processes address common coding vulnerabilities such as those in the OWASP Top 10. Secure coding practices prevent the introduction of exploitable vulnerabilities.

domains.name: Requirement 7: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know

controls.title: Access Control Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for restricting access to system components and cardholder data are documented and known to affected parties.

controls.title: Role-Based Access Control System
controls.description: An access control system is established that restricts access based on a user's need to know and covers all system components. Role-based access ensures users only access what they need for their job function.

domains.name: Requirement 8: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components

controls.title: Unique User Identification
controls.description: All users are assigned a unique ID before access to system components or cardholder data is allowed. Unique identification ensures accountability and traceability of all user actions.

controls.title: Strong Authentication for Users and Administrators
controls.description: Strong authentication mechanisms such as multi-factor authentication are implemented for all access into the cardholder data environment. MFA significantly reduces the risk of credential-based attacks.

controls.title: System and Service Account Management
controls.description: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed. Unmanaged service accounts can become persistent backdoors for attackers.

domains.name: Requirement 9: Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data

controls.title: Physical Security Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for restricting physical access to cardholder data are documented and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: Physical Access Controls for Sensitive Areas
controls.description: Physical access to sensitive areas within the cardholder data environment is controlled and monitored. Physical access controls prevent unauthorized individuals from accessing systems storing cardholder data.

domains.name: Requirement 10: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data

controls.title: Audit Logging Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for logging and monitoring are documented, in use, and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: Audit Logs Capture Required Events
controls.description: Audit logs are enabled and active for all system components to capture all required events including user access, administrative actions, and security events.

controls.title: Audit Log Review
controls.description: Audit logs are reviewed at least daily to identify anomalies or suspicious activity. Timely log review enables rapid detection and response to potential compromises.

domains.name: Requirement 11: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly

controls.title: Security Testing Policies
controls.description: All security policies and operational procedures for regular security testing are documented, in use, and known to all affected parties.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning
controls.description: Internal and external vulnerability scans are performed at least quarterly and after any significant change. Regular scanning identifies vulnerabilities before they can be exploited.

controls.title: Penetration Testing
controls.description: External and internal penetration testing is performed at least annually and after significant changes to the environment. Penetration testing validates the effectiveness of security controls from an attacker's perspective.

domains.name: Requirement 12: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs

controls.title: Information Security Policy
controls.description: An overall information security policy is established, published, maintained, and disseminated to all relevant personnel and vendors. The security policy sets the organizational tone for protecting cardholder data.

controls.title: Security Awareness Program
controls.description: A formal security awareness program is implemented to make all personnel aware of the cardholder data security policy and procedures. Security awareness reduces the risk of human-factor breaches.
